title: 4.20 Obvious exploitation of fundamental design flaws and "Paper, Scissors, Rock" effect.
body:
The release has created some awful exploitation of a combination of Smites, Jungle Buffs & Items combined with certain ULTIMATES to create devastating combos of damage unseen before the patch was released leaving little to no room for enjoyable counter play in standard matches.

(Sure, in high ELO Ranked scenarios this may be avoidable but this is not topic at hand)

----------------------------------

I'm happy enough when..
Party A plays Champ 1

Party B says "Champ 1 OP"

Party A says "Champ 1 not OP" (Then explains why)

Party B still disgruntled.

----------

I'm NOT happy when..

Party A Plays Champ 2

Party B says "Champ 2 OP and BROKEN!"

Party A says "ROFL I know, Broken as ****"

----------------------------------

Anyway, I really love the current jungle. It is  much more enjoyable and interactive than before and opens up huge amounts of strategic play but the lack of counter play that has been created is just making the game far too "Paper, Scissors, Rock" for my liking.

The recent spike in a certain champion being selected due to an obvious exploit is just beyond a joke. I don't often have a problem with having to deal with countering champs but when they feed off people who are obviously unable to counter or even understand what is going on... Example: a complete and total suppression which is unable to be broken by non AD champs (Unless you want to buy a bad item for AP *QSS*) and are pretty much dead before even being able to move a square inch away,

I'm sure I don't need to explain who this champ is, fact is that the fans even agree that it is beyond funny.

The game is becoming much too stressful due to the problems that have arisen.

I love playing jungle and I love the way it is but the new items in combination with certain champs are FAR too powerful, and with other champs the items and jungle is just FAR too strong and the Items far too nonviable.

A huge overhaul on balancing the new jungle items and champs to go along with it really needs to be done in order to bring back some balance into a very restricted and low counter play system that is currently in place.

replies.body: I didn't really read this indepth enough/I'm not smart enough to work it out, who is the champion?

I haven't had a huge issue with Warwick...

But when a champion is forced to be taken out by more than one champ at a time, that is when the problems begin. It's like always requiring a baby sitter because the enemy champion has the Trump Card and in most situations the only way to out deal this is to have 2 against it. Having to avoid a champion who is in your own jungle and being unable to flush them out or even scare them out on your own accord is quite dulling to the game play experience.

I don't like someone being able to counter jungle me whilst I'm there to protect it and being able to do little about it unless I whelp for help... And in Blind picks it's more likely than not that they will be too busy with their fingers in their noses to come help...

However I find that late game he's not a huge issue but he is still managing to stomp inexperienced players leading to them becoming more fed and far more of an issue to enjoying games than it should be.
Try buying 1-2 dorans blade in jungle.

Yeah. Only actual issue with new items is lack of HP and Mana sustain. Basically, unless you're WW or Udyr, you just get whittled down by the jungle (regardless of how fed you are) until you buy Lifesteal.

Lee, Elise, Kha and Vi (Shield passive and super quick clear times makes up for low sustain) seem like they'll be season 5 God tier from their decent sustain and early to mid game pressure with great late game utility.
Lol I never get to play champ 1 or 2 because they're always permabanned in bronze.

The counter play to WW is simply to position well enough that he can't ult you without being forced to flash to get in range and always be near someone that's able to cancel his ult and peel. 

So far the only problem I've had with jungling is the low sustain given by jungle items and respawn times on camps.
PLEASE VOTE: I would like to see some honest opinions on this. And Please post your reasons! Muchly appreciated

We are only in the pre-season, the jungle is not at it's final point and will receive tweaks.
As it currently stands yes Warwick {{champion:19}} can out farm and scale pretty much any other jungler, with a few exceptions such as Nunu {{champion:20}} .
This wont always be the case though, as data is collected other junglers will either be buffed for some extra suitability, or {{item:1039}} will come down in price letting you get 4 pot again, or the camps will deal slightly less damage or have a little less health.

As the jungle is, there is a lot that can be modified between now and the start of Season 5, as a jungle main I'm rather excited.
Be patient, watch and learn from those better than you, and as always have fun.
